patient_complaint: Persistent cough, low-grade fever, and fatigue for the past five days.
doctor_notes: Patient presents with a productive cough. Lungs sound clear, but there is some wheezing. Advised rest, hydration, and over-the-counter cough suppressants.

patient_complaint: Dizziness and a feeling of being 'off balance' with associated nausea.
doctor_notes: Patient describes brief episodes of vertigo triggered by head movements. Performed Epley maneuver in-office, with good results. Prescribed an antiemetic for nausea and advised to avoid sudden head movements.

patient_complaint: Follow-up for dizziness, which has recurred and is causing significant nausea.
doctor_notes: Patient reports a return of vertigo symptoms. Re-performed Epley maneuver, which again relieved symptoms. Prescribed a short course of an antihistamine to manage the dizziness and nausea. Emphasized the importance of home exercises.
Patient has a red and swollen throat with no signs of bacterial infection. Advised symptomatic relief with lozenges, warm liquids, and rest. No antibiotics prescribed.

patient_complaint: Headaches, more frequent and severe in the last month, sometimes accompanied by dizziness and lightheadedness.
diagnosis: Tension headaches; possible link to prior vertigo.
doctor_notes: Patient reports stress at work. Headaches and dizziness may be related to stress or a mild recurrence of BPPV. Advised stress-reduction techniques and OTC pain relievers. Prescribed a mild benzodiazepine for short-term use to help with anxiety and dizziness.

patient_complaint: Foot pain, especially in the heel, upon waking up.
doctor_notes: Tenderness upon palpation of the plantar fascia. Advised to wear supportive shoes, stretch the foot daily, and use ice packs.

patient_complaint: Dizziness and a feeling of being 'lightheaded' with severe nausea.
doctor_notes: Patient describes brief episodes of vertigo triggered by head movements. Performed Epley maneuver in-office, with good results. Prescribed Meclizine to manage the severe nausea and spinning sensation.

patient_complaint: Persistent heartburn, especially after eating spicy food.
doctor_notes: Discussed dietary and lifestyle modifications. Prescribed a proton pump inhibitor to reduce stomach acid production.

Patient came in with a severe episode of vertigo, reporting the room was spinning. Performed Epley maneuver with some relief. Advised for a follow-up visit soon to monitor progress. Prescribed a stronger anti-dizzy medication.

Patient reports some improvement but still experiences brief episodes of vertigo. Re-evaluated and re-performed the Epley maneuver. Emphasized consistency with home exercises and discussed potential vestibular rehabilitation therapy if symptoms persist. Refilled the prescription for Meclizine.
